result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joseph L. Foley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

15CF74 and 16CF111 called together. Defendant Joseph L. Foley in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Atty Forehand states there is an agreement. The agreement is $2000 for Ludwigs, paid at $50 a month. When defendant gets tax return, he will put $1000 toward the restitution, then continue paying $50 a month until paid off. Atty Forehand also states the Ludwigs will release $400 security deposit back to victim. Atty Forehand will submit a proposed order.
Restitution hearing on December 1, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Plea/sentencing in 15CF74 and 16CF11. Defendant Joseph L. Foley in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Counsel inform the Court of the parties' agreement for resolution. Def pleads to counts 1, 2, 3, 4, and 8 of 15CF74 and count 1 as amended to harassment and count 2 as amended to misdemeanor bail jumping in 16CF111. Court's colloquy on pleas. Finding of guilty.

Sentence:

15CF74
Counts 1 and 2 - DPA
Count 3 - 60 days jail with huber and good time. 4 days credit.
Counts 4 and 8 - sentence withheld for probation for 3 years. Conditions: attend, pay for, and successfully. complete 24- to 26-week d.a. class. Pay one set of costs in this case as a condition of probation.

16CF111
Count 1 as amended - 3 years probation with conditions of AODA, psych. evaluation and follow through; restitution; no contact with TW or JF unless authorized by agent. Restitution amounts requested by ADA: $3063.87 for TW's medical bills, payable to Crime Victim Comp and $3561.07 to landlords A and PL. Atty. V wants to review estimates on restitution. Court allows counsel 30 days to review. Pay one set of costs in this case as a condition of probation.
Count 2 - 30 days jail consecutive to the disorderly conduct charge in 15CF74 with huber and good time

Jail stayed until on or before Oct. 15, 2017 between 6-7 a.m.

Counts 5, 6, and 7 in 15CF74 DRI.
